page.title: 07Land Use in Leighfield
page.content: The land in Leighfield is intensively farmed. The main type of farming is arable with crops including oilseed rape, wheat and barley. The fields are large and full use is made of the most modern machinery. There are a few small areas where livestock are reared e.g. dairy cows at Withcote Lodge (808048) and sheep at Leigh Lodge (829040).There is also a small farm rearing pigs, chickens and sheep (832059) and a small horse stud farm (836057) on which are also kept a few cattle and sheep.
